title: How to Make Chewy Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Cookies

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 325°F (165 degrees C) and get a baking sheet out.
Cream together the butter and sugars with a wooden spoon until they're smooth in a medium bowl.
Beat the eggs in a small bowl with a whisk.
Add the eggs to the butter and sugar and stir them in until they're blended.
Stir in the vanilla until it is completely incorporated into the batter.
Mix the flour, baking soda and salt in a small bowl with a spoon.
Stir the dry ingredients into the creamed batter until they are blended.
Mix in the oats, walnuts and the chocolate chips.
Drop about a heaping tablespoon of dough onto an ungreased baking sheet.
steps.description: Space them about 2” apart because they will spread a bit while they are baking. Most cookie sheets can hold 12 cookies so you'll have to reuse your cookie sheet a couple of times.

steps.headline: Bake the cookies for 12 minutes.
steps.description: If you bake two sheets of cookies at a time, you may need to slightly extend the baking time.

steps.headline: Remove the cookie sheet from the oven
Allow the cookies to cool for at least five minutes on the baking sheet.
Use a metal spatula to transfer the cookies to a wire rack to complete the cooling process.
steps.description: If you remove the cookies from the baking sheet too soon, they will fall apart.

steps.headline: Serve the cookies warm with a glass of cold milk.
